subject: [Radiance-general] pkgBSDF weird behavior
body:
Dear Everyone,

I have been playing with pkgBSDF and that kind of stuff, and something
weird is happening (I think).

This is my scene (of course the references are present in the respective
directories).

##### CASE

!xform Geometry/Layer0.rad

#East Shading
!pkgBSDF -s system.xml | xform -t 0 0 .02 -rx 90 -rz 90 -t 5.02 1.02 2.27
-a 5 -t 0 1.5 0

#South Shading
!pkgBSDF -s blind0.xml | xform -rx -90 -t 2.54 0 1.869

!xform Skies/sky.rad

Anyway, when I try to render, it only works without ambient calculations
(-ab 0), and only with one pkgBSDF declaration (the BSDFs are in my
RAYPATH).

When I try to render with -ab 1, it returns:

4018 Abort trap: 6  rpict -vf Views/view.vf -ab 1 octree >
Images/south_only_AB1.hdr

When I try both together with -ab 0:

043 Abort trap: 6 rpict -vf Views/view.vf -ab 0 octree > Images/both_AB0.hdr

And, when I try both together with -ab 1:

4075 Abort trap: 6  rpict -vf Views/view.vf -ab 1 octree >
Images/both_AB1.hdr

Here you can check the images "just generated".
https://www.dropbox.com/sh/fqedoyd7jdbn0uv/rNniz9rqoI

Might this be a bug? I am using the HEAD version from about yesterday...

THANKS

Germ?n
